title: Macy’s Opts for Smaller Makeover
sub_head: Activist investor pushing for spinoff didn’t get what it wanted, but push seems to have highlighted Macy’s growing strength in e-commerce
body:
Sometimes a slight tweak yields a better look than a full-on makeover.
Macy’s , which also owns Bloomingdale’s, said Tuesday that it chose not to move forward on a spinoff of its e-commerce business. The execution risk was too high, as were the costs that would arise from debt separation and from operating separate businesses, said Chief Executive Officer Jeff Gennette in an earnings call.
